import React from "react"; import { FaProjectDiagram } from 'react-icons/fa'; import { BsFillGrid3X2GapFill } from 'react-icons/bs'; import { GiMagnifyingGlass } from "react-icons/gi"; import { IoIosBuild } from 'react-icons/io'; import { HiLightBulb, HiSpeakerphone } from 'react-icons/hi'; import "./ProjectsInfo.css"; const Siri = () => { return (

Siri Around the World

I worked with designers and managers under Siri's Conversational Interaction (CI) team to code and create two prototypes for future cross-platform interactions that users could share with Siri. The premise of my project was completely open ended. The constraints were simply to create interactions using two devices and Siri.



Due to the NDA, I cannot specifically delve into the details of the project. However, I'd like to give insight into my approach and thought process.

Problem

As a result of the open ended nature of this project, there were some immediate questions and requirements I had for my vision of these interactions:

  • How could these two devices work in unison to create a novel experience?
  • What senses are utilized in this interaction? What information is made available by these devices?
  • How would adding Siri to these two devices transform the method of communicating with Siri?
  • What is the purpose of Siri? Of the two devices? How could they overlap?
  • What are the constraints that these devices and Siri put on this project? What cannot be achieved?

Methods

Background Research

Mind Mapping

Storyboarding

Prototyping

Pitching

Concept Sketches

Insights

Data driven displays need to show information with minimal interaction from individuals

Relevant information that isn't provided by the data can be utilized in the display

Users should be able to find the information relevant to their trip quickly, without impedence, especially if they're in a rush

Solution

  1. Used color to give information about time:
    • Blue gradient to represent day
    • Orange and purple to represent dusk
    • Navy blue and purple to represent midnight​
  2. Added weather, date, and time features at the top right corner
  3. Added Atlantis Hub and branded it with a logo so that it would become the point of entry for users
  4. Organized data table in a hierarchy by transportation mode, destination, time, and then other information to provide ease of searching for travelers

Next Steps

This project has been rewarding in so many ways. It's the first time I have ever done any prototyping or animating, and even though my laptop broke in the middle of the project, the time crunch made me pick up skills related to Illustrator and Sketch very quickly. It was super enjoyable trying to learn how to use these programs for the first time.



I also learned a lot about what design is. It is very user oriented, but it also must fit in the realistic constraints of what humans and businesses are willing to do. Especially in an age where data and information are abundant, I think it is incredibly useful to know how to filter and organize relevant information for others, and how to display it so that it serves a purpose.



If I revisit this project, I would test this display on real people to receive feedback and implement changes.

); }; export default Siri;
